{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents describe anorectal endosonography as a valuable tool for imaging the anal sphincters and diagnosing defects. It is used to study patients with fecal incontinence and to evaluate the integrity of the internal and external anal sphincters. There is no mention of its use in treating dyschesia, but rather in evaluating anorectal disorders such as fecal incontinence and haemorrhoids.", "answer_choice": "B"}
